Replying to @jonasgroendahl 2018-04-27 17:48
@jonasgroendahl @Netlify If you want to avoid the code ever being somewhere public, you'd probably want to use a private code repo, which is totally viable. Often though, you might find that there are just secrets in your code (auth creds etc) which you can abstract away into env variables.

Replying to @KevinDoocey 2018-04-26 14:51
@KevinDoocey @Real_CSS_Tricks @Netlify I don't see why not. Every build ingests comments from an API and bakes them into the site, so as long as you can get your existing comments in a structured format you should be able to absorb them. I also like to commit the comments.json file to my repo for safekeeping.
